Title: Planning for Sustainable Ocean Use in Antarctica Under Global Environmental Change (PLAnT)

The Antarctic Ocean is facing unprecedented threats from climate change, yet there is no existing marine spatial planning (MSP) framework in place to ensure sustainable use and conservation of its resources. The PLAnT project addresses this critical gap by developing an integrated, sustainable MSP for Antarctica that incorporates the impacts of climate change. The project's objectives are to assess social-ecological vulnerabilities, build future scenarios, support area-based climate action, provide dynamic solutions, conduct governance analyses, and foster a paradigm shift for sustainability and equity. Given the high urgency and potential global impact of this project, it is essential to initiate this work promptly. The project's focus on climate change effects is critical for effective MSP, and its success has the potential to inspire nations to prioritize ocean sustainability. The project's approach will account for the unique political, social, and economic contextual idiosyncrasies of Antarctica, acknowledging the solution specificity risk inherent in this endeavor. By supporting the development of a sustainable MSP for Antarctica, this project will contribute significantly to the international agenda for ocean sustainability and environmental protection.
